shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Wǝddase ʾamlak “Praise of God” (fols. 2ra-154ra) I-1) Monday’s prayer of Basil of Caesarea (fols. 2ra-19va) I-2) Tuesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 19vb-45rb) I-3) Wednesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 45rb-66rb) I-4) Thursday’s prayer of John Saba (ʾArägawi Mänfäsawi) (fols. 66va-92vb) I-5) Friday’s prayer of Shenute (93ra-103ra) and Pachomius (fols. 103ra-112vb) I-6) Saturday’s prayer of Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 112vb-128vb) I-7) Sunday’s prayer of Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 128va-146rb) I-8) Ṣälotä Fäläskinos zä-hagärä Mǝnbužǝr “Prayer of Philoxenus of the Town of Mabbug" (fols. 146va-154ra)
Additio 1.

owners.owner: The names Zäkaryas and Wälättä Qǝddusan were originally mentioned in the supplication formulas but later erased or effaced (with a few exceptions, e.g., fols. 152ra, 153ra, 154ra). In a few cases the name Zäkaryas was replaced with Gäbrä Krǝstos (fols. 22va, 25rb, 95vb). His name is written interlineally in crimson, in a secondary hand.

txstates.txstate: The leather cover is torn along the upper edge of the front board, for the most part detached from the board. A part of the leather cover is missing; a piece of newspaper is glued on the front board. The tailband is partly torn off. Both boards are damaged by insects. Some fols. are affected by water.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather (partly missing); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches (or their traces) at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(1; s.l.: 1 stub after 1/fol. 1rv) – I(10/fols. 2r-11v) – II(10/fols. 12r-21v) – III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) – V(10; s.l.: 8 stub after 2, 3 stub after 7/fols. 42r-51v) – ፯VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 62r-71v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 72r-81v) – ፱IX(10/fols. 82r-91v) – ፲X(10; s.l.: 8 stub after 2, 3 stub after 7/fols. 92r-101v) – ፩XI(10; s.l.: 8 stub after 2, 3 stub after 7/fols. 102r-111v) – ፪XII(10/fols. 112r-121v) – ፲፫XIII(10/122r-131v) – ፲፬XIV(10/fols. 132r-141v) – ፲፭XV(10/fols. 142r-151v) – XVI(4; s.l.: 2 stub before 4, 3 stub after 3/fols. 152r-155v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; 1st, 3rd and 5th line of the incipit of each text (occasionally in both columns); Ethiopic numerals and the first two lines of the chapters; first two lines of the final prayers of each text and the supplication prayers of Text VII; names of the days of the week written in the upper margin throughout the Ms. and the name Fäläskinos (fols. 146v, 147r, 149r, 151r); the word mǝʾǝraf “chapter”; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text VIII contains prayers ascribed to Philoxenus of Mabbogh whose name is spelled Fäläskinos of Mänbužir. Each Text is divided into chapters (mǝʾǝraf)(s. also Ms. QQM-002 "Other details").

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Donation or acquisition note (?).
additional.det: The note is washed out and hardly legible.

extras.extra: - Fols. 1rv, 154rv, 155rv: Writing exercises (excerpts from the Ethiopic syllabary). - Fol. 1v: Traces of a prayer beginning with words ይትባረክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላከ፡ እስራኤል፡... which was washed out. - Fols. 30rb, 30vb, 36vb, 37rab, 41rb, 42rb: Corrections written over erasures, in a secondary, fine hand. - Fols. 17ra, 62rb, 71vb, 81vb, 92vb, 112vb, 113va, 128v: Erasures. - Fols. 2ra, 11ra, 11va, 16rv, 19rb, 19vb, 21ra, 23vb, 31vb, 32ra, 32va, 33vb, 40ra, 40va, 41vb, 42ra, 44rab, 45rb, 46rb, 46va, 47ra, 48vab, 53va, 65rb, 66rb, 66va, 72va, 91ra, 92rab, 92vab, 93ra, 96vab, 100vb, 103ra, 112vb, 131vab, 153ra: Names of the original donors erased.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 2, 66, 112 and 128, for navigation in the text. - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin of every other folio throughout the Ms. (and the title Fäläskinos for Text I-8).
